intro: Phoradendron roraimae, commonly known as the Roraima mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Viscaraceae family and relies on host trees for water and nutrients while performing photosynthesis. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers and red, fleshy berries that are dispersed by birds. Its unique adaptations allow it to thrive in the dense canopy of tropical forests. Phoradendron roraimae plays a role in the ecological balance by contributing to nutrient cycling and providing food for wildlife.
